title: You Wreck Me

constellations_other.name: Laughing in the face of adversity
constellations_other.description: Comedy has been used by First Nations storytellers as a tool for social change. On our screens, humour invites audiences to engage with stories and prompts them to grapple with ideas that they otherwise might shy away from.

description: In You Wreck Me, Tony Albert plays on Australia’s self-deprecating humour (known as ‘taking the piss’) to create 50 unique collages that offer a sharp and timely questioning of our national history. Painted up for ceremony, Albert’s political interpretation of Miley Cyrus’ Wrecking Ball ploughs down monuments of Captain Cook, recalling the reductive representations that are often imposed on First Peoples.
